Problem:

We examine the effect of a Fourier transformation \\( F(x) \\) defined by the function \\( F(x(t)) = \\int_{-\\infty}^\\infty x(t)e^{-i\\omega t} dt \\), on the system behavior.

Can we infer the original vector \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0 from the Fourier transform \\( F(x(T)) \\) at t = T, without knowing whether \\( F(x) \\) was initially applied?
Explanation: The Fourier transform obscures direct time-domain information such as initial states due to its integral over all times, making it impossible to precisely deduce \\( x_0 \\) without specific knowledge of the initial application of \\( F(x) \\).
